Title: A 1st for UP government schools: Parent-teacher meeting
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: Come Monday, government primary schools in Uttar Pradesh will hold their first ever parent-teacher meeting (PTM). Usually confined to private schools, it is for the first time that PTMs have been made compulsory in government schools in the state.

“With regular PTMs, the government wants to raise bar of primary schools in UP,” said an official. “It’s a platform where teachers and parents can discuss their child’s performance, his/her behaviour. Regular interactions help in better relationships, too,” said a teacher.

According to an order in this regard, teachers will apprise parents about children’s attendance and their continuous, comprehensive and evaluated progress reports. They will also be made aware of the technological advancements being implemented to improve the standard of primary education. The government also wants parents to know about the various free facilities given to their children like books, socks and shoes, sweater, uniforms, school bags and mid-day meals. In addition, parents will be apprised about the various health check-ups, besides knowing about their child’s learning outcomes.

The order by additional chief secretary, basic education, Renuka Kumar, states that PTMs are a way to encourage discussions between teachers and parents, the two main stakeholders. Through PTMs, parents will also come to know about their child’s behaviour and activities like setting up of kitchen gardens, eco club, nutrition and hand-washing campaigns.

The government is also keen to know from parents about the school’s academic atmosphere and also imparting quality education. Teachers have been asked to motivate parents to inculcate moral values and habit of cleanliness and hygiene in their child.

The order makes it compulsory for all teachers to be present in the PTMs, to be held once in three months — January, April, July and October — between 11 am to 12 noon. The PTMs will be held on second Monday of these months. In case of a holiday, the PTM should be held the next working day, reads the order. Principals and school caretakers have been instructed to send a notice in written to the parents two days before the PTM is scheduled, the order adds.

Title: EOW seeks details of pepper scam involving NCDEX from Betul firm
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: Madhya Pradesh EOW has summoned directors of Betul Oil Limited with documents pertaining to their allegations against Mumbai-based National Commodities and Derivatives Exchange (NCDEX), in connection with the ‘2012-black pepper scam’.

In December 2012, Food Safety Standard Authority (FSSAI) had sealed six NCDEX-accredited warehouses in Kerala’s Alappuzha and Kochi after samples were found coated with carcinogenic oils and paraffin. Directors of Betul Oil claim that their pepper worth Rs 72 cr got stuck due to cheating and have accused NCDEX of breaching their trust. Sources say, pepper worth nearly Rs 300 cr is locked up in the warehouses of NCDEX, seized by FSSAI and there are many traders who are facing similar troubles like Betul Oil.

EOW Bhopal had received a complaint from M/s Betul Oil Limited, Industrial Area Kosmi, and Betul through their company secretary Abhinaya Kulkarni a month ago.

In April 2004 the NCDEX allowed trading of “Malabar Garbled 1 Pepper” on its trading platform. Garbled peppers are processed ones for direct human consumption. In January 2012, NCDEX put around 6,300 MT processed pepper on sale. Betul Oil had purchased 1729.919 MT of black pepper for Rs 72.26 crore from this trading platform. Purchase was made through brokers and agents who were members of NCDEX.

A few days later, Betul Oil came to know through media that NCDEX accredited warehouses has been sealed by FSSAI following stocks containing inferior quality of pepper. With around Rs 72 cr at stake, company officials wrote a letter to Food Safety Commissioner, Trivandrum on November 17, 2012 requesting to conduct sample testing of pepper stored with National Collateral Management Services Limited and JICS Logistics Limited.

The complainant also requested NCDEX to provide samples of stocks of pepper stored in the warehouse. On receipt, the samples were tested at FSSAI approved Sterling Test House and Export Inspection Agency, which found the pepper to be contaminated with mineral oil. NCDEX would have delivered adulterated pepper had the stock not been sealed by FSSAI authorities in Kerala, say EOW officials. FSSAI had even ordered to destroy adulterated pepper but NCEDX moved court for a stay. Eight years on, disposal of seized peppers is yet to be decided.

EOW has put several senior officials of NCDEX under scanner including the then MD and DEO and officials of National Collateral Management Services Limited (NCMSL) for allegedly procuring adulterated black pepper and placing the stock issuing false quality certificate, thus causing undue loss to several companies including M/s Betul Oil Limited and other companies. “NCDEX was under obligation to ensure and check quality and grade of commodities besides being accountable for proper deposit and delivery of commodities. It a case of breach of trust and cheating,” said an EOW officer.

Warehouse service is provided by NCMSL and JICS Logistics Limited, and they accept commodities from the sellers and depositors on the certification issues by the Assayer i.e. NCMSL. Thus, only the goods which meet the standards prescribed in the contract are to be accepted in the warehouses, said the officer adding all those involved would be brought to book.

Title: Odisha open to Ayushman scheme if 2 riders met: Min
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The state government has for the first time clearly indicated that it is willing to embrace the Centre’s flagship national health scheme ‘ Ayushman Bharat’ provided its conditions are met.

Health minister Naba Kishore Das on Monday said the state government has put forward two conditions to the Centre based on which it will take a call on merging its own Biju Swasthya Kalyan Yojana (BSKY), launched in August 2018, with the central healthcare scheme.

“The state government has asked the Centre to consider two suggestions for the merger of BSKY and Ayushman Bharat. First, the Centre should not insist on Aadhar for treatment at government hospitals. Second, all 70 lakh families currently covered under BSKY be included in Ayushman Bharat. The Centre is yet to respond. Once the Centre replies, we are open to examine it and take a decision,” Das said, adding, “The ball is in the Centre’s court.”

Under the proposed parameters, around 63 lakh families would be covered under the central scheme. State health department sources said the state has sent at least three communications to the Union health ministry regarding its suggestions to implement Ayushman Bharat.

Union petroleum minister and state BJP leader Dharmendra Pradhan, who was in Bhubaneswar on Monday, said the state should shun its apprehensions and join the central scheme in larger public interest. Earlier, Union health minister Harsh Vardhan, during his visit here on December 25, had urged Naveen to implement the central scheme.

Speculation is rife about the merger of BSKY and Ayushman Bharat ever since the state government announced the convergence of its cash assistance scheme for farmers Kalia with the central PM KISAN scheme, apparently due to financial constraints. The BJP-BJD bonhomie after the Lok Sabha polls is being given out as another reason behind such speculations.

Sources said the state has spent more than Rs 700 crore under BSKY in the past one year and is looking to reduce its financial burden by merging it with the central scheme. In Ayushman Bharat, the cost is shared in the ratio of 60:40 by the Centre and the states (for states like Odisha). The state promises annual health cover of Rs 5 lakh to eligible families and Rs 10 lakh for women members of the families.

Odisha Pradesh Congress Committee president Niranjan Patnaik said Naveen used BSKY to win elections and after victory, he sees no reason to spend on it exploring possibilities to merge it with the central scheme.

Title: Smog engulfs Trichy city as garbage burns everywhere
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Trichy: Be it city roads or national highways passing through the city, waste mounds dumped by corporation workers and the public along the roads in the city are periodically set on fire causing smog to engulf the city neighbourhoods every morning.

Ever since the garbage bins placed on the public spots were removed by the corporation in the last two years, public littering has drastically increased to all parts of the city. Vacant plots and spaces along the roads remain an easy target for commercial establishments and residents to dump their waste including plastic litters because of slackness in door-to-door waste collection.

As the waste accumulated in vacant lands are seldom cleared, the easy way out for sanitary workers to get rid of it is to set them on fire, locals said. “Ponmalaipatti road connecting Ponmalai with Trichy-Pudukkottai National Highways witnesses smog completely covering the road daily. Waste accumulated on the vacant plots are persistently set on fire, causing the air quality to take a plunge,” said K C Neelamegam, Trichy based environmentalist.

The problem of burning the waste mound at will is not restricted to a particular locality but is widespread in all four zones including Karumandapam, Crawford, Cantonment, Palpannai and E Pudur. Even the vacant space adjacent to the Trichy-Chennai and Trichy-Dindigul national highways in the city are not spared.

Sources said that the waste mounds were set on fire by sanitary workers as they are not interested in transporting the waste to micro compost centres since it involves segregating the waste manually. Sanitary workers have been blamed for picking only plastic waste as it can be traded for a price, while other wastes are burnt near roads.

As such burning of waste will take a toll among the residents having respiratory ailments, locals urged the civic body to take action against the perpetrators. “We will inquire into the incidents. Sanitary workers were already told not to burn waste on roads,” a sanitary inspector with Trichy Corporation said.

Title: Maharashtra: Buddies killed after bike rams parked car
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: A car parked near a blind turn on Pune-Panshet Road without switching on its hazard lights cost two bike-borne friends their lives on Sunday evening.

The duo — Prathamesh Ramdas Mate (21) and Akshay Dhananjy Jori (21) from Khadakwasla — went to the other side of the road to go ahead of the stationary car. At the same time, an MSRTC bus came from the opposite side. In an attempt to avoid crashing into the bus, the one riding the bike applied sudden brakes. The two-wheeler skidded and hit the car. The duo fell on the road.

Mate and Jori died because of severe head injuries. “They were not wearing helmets,” said assistant inspector Nitin Nam of the Haveli police.

The police have registered an offence against the car’s driver for causing the deaths due to negligence.

On Sunday, Jori and Mate had gone to the former’s native village near Panshet. They were returning home late in the evening via Pune-Panshet Road. There was traffic on the road. “A group of people, who had gone to Panshet in a rented car, were also returning to Pune around the same time. When they reached near Khanapur , around 22km from the city, their car developed a technical snag,” he said.

The driver stopped the car on the road, just before a blind turn. “The driver did not switch on any hazard warning lights or indicators to alert other drivers,” Nam said.

Jori and Mate reached near the snag-hit car around 6.30pm. In an attempt to cross it, they went to the other side of the road. At the same time an MSRTC bus on Swargate-Panshet route came from the opposite side.

“To avoid crashing into the bus, the motorcycle rider applied the brakes all of a sudden. The bike skidded and crashed into the parked car,” Nam said. Jori and Mate fell and suffered severe head injuries, he said.

The residents of the area rushed them to a nearby hospital, where the doctors pronounced them dead, the assistant inspector said. “The car driver caused the accident. He should have switched on the hazard lights or indicators,” he said, adding that their probe was on.

Title: Constable held for stealing Rs 1L, car & bike from partner
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Trichy: The Perambalur police arrested a police constable attached to the Armed Reserve (AR) wing in Perambalur late on Sunday on charges of cheating a couple of men.

Perambalur district crime branch police arrested Chandramohan, 39, serving at AR based on a complaint from A Bharathiraja, 27, of Perambalur. The police said that Chandramohan reportedly had a stake in a restaurant run by Bharathiraja and Sathishkumar at Thanneerpandhal in Perambalur on the Trichy- Chennai national highway.

According to the complaint, an issue cropped between the partners of the restaurant, during which Chandramohan stole the car, bike and cash Rs 1 lakh from Bharathiraja and escaped. Bharathiraja’s attempts to get back his properties went in vain as Chandramohan allegedly refused to return them.

Bharathiraja lodged a complaint with Perambalur SP Nisha Parthiban a couple of days back, who forwarded the complaint to the district crime branch for further investigation.

The preliminary inquiry brought to light Chandramohan’s role in the crime following which the police booked him for cheating. He was arrested and the car, bike and cash was recovered from him.

The police produced him in the court and was remanded him in judicial custody on Sunday night.

Title: NHAI removes saplings near flyover on Trichy-Thanjavur NH
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Trichy: Tension prevailed for a while near Ariyamangalam flyover on Monday as the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) workers removed a few tree saplings planted along the Trichy-Thanjavur National Highway. NHAI authorities reasoned that the saplings would disturb the stability of the flyover when they grow.

Sources said that youths belonging to Thiruverumbur locality a few months back had planted several native tree saplings near the bridge. The saplings were provided protection and maintained by the youths as part of their efforts to increase the city’s green cover.

Representatives of NHAI toll plaza on Trichy-Thanjavur NH claimed that they had intimated the locals to remove the saplings voluntarily. “Owing to safety concerns, we already informed the locals to remove the four to five saplings planted very close to the flyover. Since the saplings were not removed, our workers removed them,” an official source said. On coming to know about NHAI’s move on Monday, the locals argued with the toll plaza staff against the action.

However, as officials made it clear that the saplings can be planted in other places, in a manner not causing any threat to the bridge, locals dispersed from the spot. “We are not against the tree plantation drive, but the saplings should be planted in a proper place,” the official added.

Title: Meerut: SP slams BJP for ‘orchestrating clashes’, gives cheque of Rs 5 lakh each to kin of deceased
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

representative image

MEERUT: Leader of opposition in the UP’s legislative assembly Ram Govind Chaudhry opened a scathing attack on the ruling BJP over the violence against the backdrop of protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act on December 20. “I have been saying this from the beginning and will say it over and over again. BJP and police did this to defame the ongoing movement,” SP leader Chaudhary said.

He was leading a delegation of party which met with the family members of the deceased who were killed during the violent protests. A cheque of Rs 5 lakh was handed over to each of the family members of the five deceased. Six people had died during the protests in Meerut and cheques were handed over to five families, all residents of minority-dominated Lisari Gate area.

“BJP does not have faith on either Constitution or democracy. If they had any faith, they would not have used such stunts to bring misery on people,” Chaudhary said.

Title: Bijnor: Cane farmers to stage protests in spite of section 144
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

The sugar mills in the state already owe Rs 4,000 crore to 40 lakh farmers Uttar Pradesh

BIJNOR: With section 144 of CrPC imposed across Uttar Pradesh in view of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) protests, sugarcane farmers have not staged protests against non-payment of dues by sugar mills though harvesting has begun. Crushing will continue till April.

Now, farmer organizations have decided to resume their agitation, pointing out that they have nothing to do with the CAA protests. While the Azad Kisan Union has announced a “jail bharo andolan” on January 10 in Bijnor, Bharatiya Kisan Union has called for a panchayat on January 9.

The sugar mills in the state already owe Rs 4,000 crore to 40 lakh farmers across the state for the current crushing season, which commenced in October. In addition, mills owe Rs 2,000 crore as dues for the previous (2018-19) crushing season. Farmers are also unhappy as the state government has not revised SAP (state advised price) for the past two years.

There are 119 sugar mills in the state and so far, they have crushed around 3,500 lakh quintal sugarcane in current crushing season.

According to data available with the cane department here, mills have paid Rs 4,107 crore to farmers – this accounts for 50% of dues to farmers. As per norms, mills have to clear the dues within 14 days of the delivery of produce to sugar units. But mills have failed to do so. Besides, many mills are yet to clear last year’s outstanding dues, which is around Rs 2,017 crore.

Now, Azad Kisan Union has announced its decision to launch an agitation. Talking with TOI, national president of Azad Kisan Union Rajendra Singh, said, “SAP has not been hiked for the past two years. The prices have neither been increased nor dues are being cleared on time.”

Singh said, “In Bijnor district, three mills -- Bilai, Bijnor and Chandpur -- have not paid a single penny for the current season. They have even failed to clear last year’s dues.”

He further stated, “Administration had imposed section 144 in the state. We will launch our agitation. There is no way left for us. We will march to the collectorate on January 10 and launch a ‘jail bharo andolan’ to press for payment of pending dues. We are ready to go to jail.”

Bharatiya Kisan Union’s district president Digambar Singh said, “We will hold a panchayat on January 9 here in Bijnor and chalk out plans for the agitation. Many mills have failed to clear the dues. The Power Corporation is also disconnecting connections to farmers for failing to pay their electricity bills. Farmers are facing lot of financial hardships.”

Title: Bulandshahr: UP cops rescue Ranchi girl, unearth trafficking racket which sold girls for marriages
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Police have arrested the trafficker and six others

MEERUT: The deal was struck at Rs 75,000, and the highest bidder was delighted. The girl, just 16, still dazed and bleeding from the fresh beating, was wondering where the life would take her now. Sitting inside a cramped room full of “buyers” and a notorious trafficker-- about 1,300km away from the village in Ranchi district where she grew up-- all she thought of was her mother, whose death a year ago changed it all. The step-mother allegedly sold her to Kalawati, 35, a trafficker who brought her to Bulandshahr a few days ago.

However, the fate had other plans.

Acting on a tip-off, police raided the house which was being used as a trafficking hub for the last several days and arrested Kalawati and six men, who had come to “purchase” the girl so that they could marry her.

Senior superintendent of police (SSP) of Bulandshahr, Santosh Kumar Singh, said, “People from western UP and Haryana used to come here to purchase girls for the purpose of marriage.

“In this case, six persons had gathered at the house in city’s Ahmedgarh area on Friday. Following a tip-off, a raid was conducted. The minor girl who was rescued has been sent for medical examination and was later produced before magistrate.”

According to sources in police, the girl was being “auctioned” and several buyers had come for bidding. “She was sold for Rs 75,000 to one of the buyers from Bulandshahr’s Khurja area,” a police officer told TOI, on condition of anonymity. The copy of the FIR, which is with TOI, corroborated his claims.

Reacting to the development, Meerut IG (range) Alok Singh said, “We will share the investigation details with anti-human trafficking unit (AHTU) also for better coordination in the future.”

The girl was later taken to district child welfare committee (CWC) for counseling. “We have contacted CWC in Ranchi. Arrangements are being made to transfer the girl there. She will be rehabilitated there by the panel,” said Bhupendra Singh, a member of CWC in Bulandshahr.

“The area has become a hub for trafficking of girls and woman from states like Jharkhand and Bihar. They are sold to families, especially from western UP and Haryana seeking women for marriage due to skewed sex ratio,” the source said.

Title: Bhopal united in protest against JNU violence
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Ex-IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan at the protest on Monday.

BHOPAL: While addressing a gathering of protesters sitting on a ‘ satyagraha ’ against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), National Population Register ( NPR ) and the National Register Citizens at Bhopal’s Iqbal Maidan on Monday, former IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan said that what happened at the campus of Delhi’s Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) “never even happened during emergency” and that for the first time, students and teachers of universities were being “thrashed inside the campuses”.

Gopinathan was referring to the Sunday evening attack by masked people on students and teachers on JNU campus .

“They are scared of only one thing: questions. They feel that if anyone asks any questions, then he or she should be silenced,” said the ex-IAS officer who had resigned following the revocation of Article 370 in the erstwhile state of Jammu and Kashmir.

“If any student asks questions, then they are silenced by calling them ‘tukde tukde gang’. If any working-class person asks any questions, then they are silenced by being called ‘Urban Naxals’. If poor tribals ask questions, they are silenced by being labelled Maoists. If Muslims asks questions, they are silenced by being called terrorists”, he said.

Speaking on CAA, NRC and NPR, Gopinathan said, “There are three things. Firstly, they are anti-constitution, then they are anti-poor and then they are anti-Muslims.”

Urging the state government to refrain from conducting the NPR exercise, he said, “If the government have said that they are against CAA and NRC, then they should also not allow NPR.”

Title: Minati Mishra dies at 91 in Switzerland
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Bhubaneswar: Renowned Odissi exponent Dr Minati Mishra passed away in Zurich, Switzerland, on Monday. She was 91. Chief minister Naveen Patnaik expressed condolences on the sad demise of the noted dancer. “I am deeply saddened by the death of noted Odissi danseuse Minati Mishra. Her lifelong contribution to enhance the glory of Odissi dance is unforgettable. My heartfelt condolences are with the bereaved family at this time of grief,” CM tweeted.

Born in 1929 in Cuttack, Mishra started learning Odissi dance and music at an early age under the tutelage of Kabichandra Kalicharan Patnayak, a known Odissi dancer and under noted Odissi exponent Guru Kelucharan Mahapatra. In 1954, Mishra joined Kalakshetra of Rukmini Devi Arundale on a scholarship from the Government of Odisha and learned Bharatanatyam for one year. She was awarded a doctoral degree in Indology from the Philipp University of Marburg, Germany. From 1964 to 1989 she served as the principal of Utkal Sangeet Mahavidyalaya, Bhubaneswar.

Minati Mishra has acted in several Odia movies. The first among them, Suryamukhi was released in 1963, followed by four more movies — “Jeevan Sathi, Sadhana, Bhai Bhauja” and “Arundhati”. All the movies, except “Bhai Bhauja”, received the National Film Award for the best regional cinema. Not only in dance and cinema but Mishra was a versatile artist and was a Grade-A artist at AIR and received Sangeet Prabhakar title for Hindustani vocal.

She has won several award, including Padma Shri in 2012.

Title: Meerut: Winter chill makes a comeback as Meerut witnesses sporadic rainfall
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: After a few days of clear weather, the winter chill made a comeback in Meerut. The city also experienced sporadic rainfall on Monday. The temperature here remained considerably low as the difference between maximum and minimum temperature dipped – even as minimum temperature was more than Sunday’s temperature.

“The maximum and minimum temperature recorded in Meerut on Monday were 15.2 degrees Celsius and 10.6 degrees Celsius, respectively. The maximum and minimum humidity levels recorded here on Monday were 82% and 78%, respectively. The city recorded 0.4mm of rainfall on Monday,” said Brij Mohan, meteorological in-charge, Meerut.

While the minimum temperature recorded here on Monday was higher than what was recorded on Sunday, the chill was more on Monday due to the lesser difference between maximum and minimum temperature.

On Sunday, the difference between maximum and minimum temperature was 9.6 degree Celsius as against Monday’s diurnal range of temperature (difference between maximum and minimum temperature) which was recorded at 4.6 degree Celsius.

“The diurnal range of temperature plays a major role in deciding how cold or warm the day will be. Monday was colder than Sunday because the difference between maximum and minimum temperature was lesser than Sunday. Rainfall is predicted in the coming days,” said Mohan.

Title: Meerut: Rs 2 lakh, looted jewellery belongings of murdered Bhajan singer’s family recovered from Delhi flat
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Ajay Pathak (above) , his wife Sneha Pathak (42) and daughter Vasundhra Pathak (16) were murdered in Shamli on... Read More

MEERUT: Police have recovered Rs 2 lakh cash and huge amount of gold and silver jewellery belonging to Shamli-based Bhajan singer Ajay Pathak , who along and his wife and their two children were fpound murdered at their house on December 30. The recovery made from a flat in Santnagar in Delhi’s Burari area also included wallet, purse, expensive watches, laptop bag and luggage bags belonging to Pathak family.

“We have taken DNA samples of the accused, which would be matched with the ones collected from the spot. The recovery of the looted items was made from the rented flat in Delhi. The weapon used in the murders have also been recovered,” Adarsh Mandi SHO Karamveer Singh said.

Ajay, his wife Sneha Pathak (42) and daughter Vasundhra Pathak (16) were murdered with a sharp-edged weapon at their Shamli house on the night of December 30. Police said during interrogation, Himanshu Saini, a disciple of Ajay, confessed to have killed the entire family for not returning Rs 60,000 they owed to him. Himanshu alleged that he was insulted by Ajay every time he asked for his money.

The recovery was made after local police, which has formed an SIT to investigate the brutal murder of the family, secured four-day police custody of the accused, Himanshu. “The SIT made the recovery following interrogation inputs of the accused,” an official in Shamli police said.

Himanshu, was arrested by Haryana police on January 1. According to Panipat police, Himanshu was arrested when he was trying to flee after setting ablaze Pathak’s SUV which had his son's body in the rear seat. Police have sent the charred body for forensic and post-mortem examination.

Detailing on the modus operandi, UP's Shamli police had said that after dinner, as the family was sleeping, Himanshu first went to Ajay’s room and attacked him and his wife Sneha with a sword. Then he went to Vasundhra’s room and killed her. He then strangulated 14-year-old Bhagwad to death.

Himanshu planned to dispose all the bodies. He first took Bhagwad’s body to Panipat. “But when he got to know that the news of the murders has spread, he set the car on fire and was trying to flee,” police had said.

Title: Where and when was Shoaib arrested, high court asks UP government
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: Hearing the habeas corpus petition of an advocate who was allegedly arrested after the December 19 protest against the amendment in the citizenship law and National Register of Citizens in the city, the Lucknow bench of the Allahabad High Court has granted the UP government a week’s time to file an additional counter affidavit giving the exact time and place from where he was arrested and also the details of his production before the judicial magistrate in the civil court before sending him to jail under judicial custody.

A bench of Justice Shahibul Hasnain and Justice Virendra Kumar II passed the order on the petition moved on behalf of advocate Mohammad Shoaib through his next friend Gaurav Kumar Kashyap. On the previous hearing on January 3, the court had expressed concern when the additional government advocate (AGA) SP Singh was not able to assist the court properly for want of adequate instructions from the police.

The investigating officer Brijendra Kumar Mishra was also present, but the court found that even he was not able to give correct instructions to the AGA.

The petitioner had then alleged that his arrest is illegal as the time and manner shown by the police was incorrect and concocted. The petitioner even questioned the proceedings of judicial remand, alleging that he was never produced before a magistrate, rendering his custody illegal. It was also said in the petition that he was placed under house arrest on the night of December 18, which continued on December 19 and he was not allowed to venture out.

The petitioner’s lawyer, AB Solomon had then stated that the petitioner was never produced before any magistrate. “Had he been produced before a magistrate, the time and place of the court would have been captured in CCTV cameras that cover the entire campus for surveillance”, he had said.

Expressing concern on the petitioner’s argument, the court had then directed the AGA to come prepared on this issue in the next hearing.

When the matter came up on Monday, the AGA vehemently opposed the contentions of the petitioner that his custody was illegal. He placed records showing that the petitioner was properly produced for the judicial custody before being sent to jail.

“The other accused persons in the case are getting bail, but Shoaib has not done the same because of ulterior motive and to sensationalise the matter unnecessarily,” argued the AGA. He also sought time to file additional affidavit in this regard to which the court agreed.

Title: Bijnor villagers gun down leopard that killed boy, 6th victim in a month
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

A leopardess is hiding for the past 10 days in the sugarcane fields near Mohandiya village in Bijnor tehsil, 3... Read More

BIJNOR: Hours after a leopard killed a 14-year-old boy at Bhogpur village in Bijnor ’s Najibabad tehsil, enraged villagers shot dead the animal after cordoning off a sugarcane field on Monday. Armed with guns, they combed the cane field, found the leopard and killed it. Then they dragged the carcass up to the village.

Since November 27, six persons, including the teenager, have been killed in leopard attacks in the district. A leopardess is hiding for the past 10 days in the sugarcane fields near Mohandiya village in Bijnor tehsil, 30 km from for the spot where the leopard was killed, and is said to have killed three people in the area.

After learning about the leopard’s killing, senior officials, including DM Ramakant Pandey, Najibabad SDM Sangita and SP (city) Lakshmi Nivas Mishra reached the village with a large number of policemen. While the boy’s body was sent to the district hospital for autopsy, a post-mortem was also carried out on the leopard.

Talking to TOI, Najibabad divisional forest officer Manoj Kumar Shukla said, “The leopard killed Prashant Kumar (14) of Bhogpur village. Later, villagers shot the big cat dead. The boy’s family will be given Rs 5 lakh as compensation.”

SP (city) Mishra said, “A case will be registered in this connection based on the complaint of forest authorities.”

According to officials, Prashant Kumar, son of Jai Prakash, was a class VII student at the government primary school. He had left school around 1pm after taking his midday meal. The school is located on the outskirts of Bhogpur village, near sugarcane fields.

He was walking towards the sugarcane field when a male leopard suddenly emerged from the cane stalks, pounced on him, dragged him into the field and killed him. A passerby, Kapil Kumar, who witnessed the attack and tried to rescue the boy was also injured. He is stated to be out of danger.

As news of the boy’s death spread in the village, hundreds of villagers, including the deceased’s family, picked up their guns and went to the cane field where the killer leopard was said to be hiding. They combed the field and found the big cat, shooting him dead on the spot. They dragged the carcass up to the village.

Taking cognizance of the incident, basic shiksha adhikari Mahesh Chandra has set up an inquiry and sought an explanation from school staff of Bhogpur as to why the student was out during the school time. The BSA said all teachers had already been instructed not to allow any student to play on its ground or go near the cane fields alone.

Officials told TOI that the leopard was an adult male, about seven years old.

With the death of the killer leopard, speculation that a leopardess had killed all the victims has ended. Despite forest authorities setting up several cages at Mohandiya village with chicken and mutton as bait, the leopardess eluded them. On Sunday, its picture was captured by one of the several trap cameras set up in the area, indicating that it is still lurking near Mohandiya village.

Title: False smut fungus bugs Pudukottai farmers
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Pudukottai: Paddy farmers of Avudaiyarkoil block in Pudukottai district are reeling under the sudden impact of false smut fungal infection that has affected their samba crop. False smut is a disease which affects the early flowering of the crop and destroys its ovary thus causing a reduction in the size of the grains.

Farmers from Aranthangi, Avudaiyarkoil, Manalmedu, Alangudi and Arimalam have raised samba paddy crop on thousands of acres thanks to good rain this year. However, with just a few weeks left for harvesting, the sudden manifestation of the disease has left them shell-chocked. A Pilavendhiran, a farmer in Avanam Perungudi in Aranthangi block, has raised paddy on 7 acres and was awaiting harvest. “To my disbelief, I found a major part of my crops suddenly falling prey to the fungus,” he said.

“Even though we got enough rain, the crops were completely destroyed at the eleventh hour. The government should disburse immediate relief to the affected farmers”, he said. State general secretary of Farmers Forum of India G S Ganapathi said that ‘Nel Pazham’ (in Tamil) or Laxmi disease has destroyed the grains of farmers in Aranthangi and Avudaiyarkoil.

“We have decided to take the issue to the district administration demanding compensation to the affected”, he added. Confirming the prevalence of the disease in some parts of Aranthangi, Aavudaiyarkoil, Manamelkudi and Alangudi blocks, joint director of agriculture Pudukottai Subbaiah told TOI, “We are conducting awareness camps at all the villages to educate farmers on how to tackle the situation. We have suggested applying propiconazole. The agriculture department has taken the required measures to curb the fungus”.

Title: Renovation of ‘Kalasam’ atop Big Temple under way
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Thanjavur: In view of the consecration of Brihadheswarar Temple in Thanjavur scheduled to be held on February 5, the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR&CE) officials have commenced the process of cleaning the giant ‘Kalasam’ fixed atop the 216-ft tower (gopuram) on Sunday.

As part of the consecration, the authorities of Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) commenced work on the temple a few months ago. A scaffolding was erected covering the tower above the main sanctum sanctorum to allow workers perform chemical cleaning.

As the work commenced by ASI is nearing completion, the HR&CE authorities have taken up various works including cleaning the copper kalasam and coating it with gold. After getting approval from ASI, the kalasam – which weighs 25 tonnes and comprises eight parts - was brought down from the tower.

Earlier, scientists from Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic Research and a technical team from Indian Institute of Technology in Chennai examined the kalasam.

The consecration of the temple, which is a World Heritage Monument, is scheduled to be performed after a gap of more than two decades. The last consecration was held in 1997. The subsequent consecration should have been held in 2009 or 2010.

Title: ‘Use of plastic carry bags has dipped significantly’
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Trichy: The first Vaikunda Ekadasi being celebrated at Srirangam after the ban on single-use plastic came into force has some news to cheer for Trichy corporation. Officials said that usage of banned plastic products and the quantity of plastic waste accumulated during the festival have significantly come down compared to the previous years. The state government banned the usage of 16 types of single-use plastic products on January 1. Since then the corporation officials have conducted surprise inspections along Chithirai streets and Uthira Streets during festival times to penalise the offenders.

“We have seized 10 kg of banned plastic products, mostly from street vendors and have imposed fine of up to Rs 500 on them. There has been a desirable change among the traders as well as people,” a sanitary inspector with the corporation said. They have collected Rs 5,000 as penalty from shops and street vendors on Monday. Sources said that a majority of the devotees have found carrying cloth bag or jute bag instead of plastic carry bags. The behavioural change has also reflected in the quantity of waste collected by the sanitary workers. “Out of the 5 tonnes of waste we removed from the temple locality, plastic waste is only 1 tonne. Previously, the amount of plastic waste was high,” the official added.

Title: Bijnor: All protest victims died in police firing: Subhashini Ali of CPI(M)
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

BIJNOR: Senior CPI(M) leader Subhashini Ali, who has been visiting Uttar Pradesh districts affected by violence for the past few days, claimed at an interaction with media that all casualties in the state were from police firing. The daughter of freedom fighters Colonel Prem Sehgal and Captain Lakshmi Sehgal of the INA, Ali reached Nahtaur late evening on Sunday, met family members of Suleman and Anas, who were shot dead allegedly by cops during the anti-NRC-CAA protest on December 20 that turned violent.

She said, “All those who were killed during the protests against CCA died from police bullets. That’s why aggrieved families have not been provided post mortem reports.” The former MP alleged, “Some people in the government are using the language of hate about citizens, saying they’ll take revenge. This is deplorable.”

She added, “I met the victim’s families in Nahtaur. They told me there were many people in plainclothes with the cops who lathicharged protesters. Cops say they are ‘police mitras’. Who are these? Who appointed them? Who gave them service-issue batons? Whether they were RSS or Bajrang Dal men needs to be investigated.”

She further stated, “CAA is a poor law. It is based on religion. Government should have mentioned that all people persecuted for their religion will be accommodated.”

Two people were killed and several injured in the violence at Nahtaur on December 20. Three cases were registered against protesters. Police had claimed they had killed Suleman in self-defense, while Anas was killed by a stray bullet fired by protesters.

A SIT was formed to probe the case and a magisterial probe is on. Family members of the deceased had filed complaints against cops, alleging that both Suleman and Anas were shot dead by cops. But their FIRs were not registered. Instead, their complaints were included in cases registered earlier by cops.

Title: Can't keep funding losses at UK's steel plant: Tata Group chairman N Chandrasekaran
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Tata Group chairman N Chandrasekaran (File photo)

LONDON: Tata Group chairman N Chandrasekaran said the steel conglomerate cannot have a situation where India keeps funding the mounting losses at its struggling Port Talbot steelworks in the UK. He emphasised that the Port Talbot steelworks in Wales, one of the largest in Europe, needed to be "self-sustaining" in an interview with the Sunday Times.

The head of the 84-billion pound turnover conglomerate refused to commit to continuing to make UK steel, the report said. Chandrasekaran said, "I need to get to a situation where at least the plant (Port Talbot) is self-sustaining. Whether it is in the Netherlands or here, we can't have a situation where India keeps funding the losses just to keep it going."

Tata Steel's pre-tax losses were 371 million pounds last year, up from 222 million pounds in 2017-18. In November, Tata announced plans to cut 3,000 jobs across Europe. Just under half of Tata's 8,385-strong UK workforce are based in Port Talbot, the BBC reported on Sunday.

Paul Evans, the Unite labour union's regional officer for Wales, said, "This interview just adds more pressure on the Tata workers at Port Talbot. The site is obviously key to the future of the other Tata plants in Wales.

A spokesman for Tata Steel's European operations said, "What our chairman said has already been communicated to colleagues through our transformation programme." "That programme is about building a stronger and more sustainable European steel business by improving profitability so we can pay for investments necessary to secure our long-term future," the BBC report quoted the company spokesman.

Title: Yogi Adityanath, Raman Singh to join party’s CAA contact drive in Madhya Pradesh
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

UP CM Yogi Adityanath

BHOPAL: The BJP is rolling out the big guns to drum up support for Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) in Madhya Pradesh, where chief minister Kamal Nath has said a clear ‘no’ to the controversial law.

BJP chief Amit Shah will visit Jabalpur on January 12. Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath and former Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh will arrive next to join BJP’s CAA awareness campaign that is likely to stretch till civic elections in the state.

“Senior leaders of BJP will participate in the mass awareness and contact campaign in Madhya Pradesh. Party president Amit Shah will address a rally in Jabalpur on January 12. We have also invited UP CM Yogi Adityanath and former Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh,” BJP state spokesperson Rajneesh Agrawal told TOI on Monday.

Yogi is likely to visit between January 10 and 15, say sources. Union minister Narendra Singh Tomar will be in Gwalior on January 7, and Raman Singh is expected to address a rally in Dhar around that time. BJP youth wing nation head Poonam Mahajan will participate in an awareness campaign in Dewas on January 8. Union ministers Thawar Chand Gehlot and Faggan Singh Kulaste, former Lok Sabha Speaker Sumitra Mahajan and former Rajasthan minister Arun Chaturvedi will join the campaign during the month, say sources.

The BJP campaign will focus on minorities and those opposing the citizenship law, say its leaders. “Congress is spreading lies that the law is against Muslims, but the Act does not mention Indian Muslims. We are contacting all communities to create awareness. Those who are willing to share their opinions have also joined the drive. However, the likes of Congress, who despite knowing the truth are creating confusion and instigating hatred among castes, need not be considered,” said BJP state spokesperson Deepak Vijayvargiya.

Sources in BJP said the party has chalked out a month-long plan, including door-to-door campaign till January 15. “CAA is a very sensitive and crucial issue. Barring a few groups, majority of the public supports the law despite opposition and confusion created by Congress and other opposition parties. The well-planned BJP campaign will not only help people understand the significance of the law but will also create an impact among voters ahead of civic elections in the state,” said a senior BJP state functionary.

Sources said BJP is focusing on communities whose members or their relatives have migrated from Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh, seeking refuge in India.

Title: City’s 2019 conviction rate highest in the past decade
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Vijayawada: The city police commissionerate saw a huge improvement in the conviction rate, which hit 50% in 2019, as compared to the national average of 48.8%. The highest conviction rate in the past 10 years was 42.3% in 2013. In 2018, the city’s conviction rate stood at 40% and before that, it was a mere 34% which was just 1% above the state 33%.

Out of the conviction achieved, seven cases saw the accused getting life imprisonment—one case with a 20-year imprisonment, two cases with 10-year imprisonments. Nevertheless, sources said that a number of issues plague the directorate of prosecution in the city, from delays in trials to a lack of evidence. According to cops, the main reason behind the low conviction rate was predominantly hostile witnesses. Other factors include lack of support from independent witnesses during the trial and both parties having out of court settlements through Lok Adalat.

Compared to 2018, overall, cases that achieved conviction also came down substantially by 43%. This was attributed to the state government’s ‘Spandana’ initiative, which even the city police commissioner acknowledged during the annual press meet, saying that it had helped the police dispose a bulk of cases in one go every week. In fact, the overall petitions disposed under Spandana initiative is 41% more than the cases achieving conviction in the courts.

Officials said that there had been a large number of acquittals in SCs/STs Atrocity cases in the courts and suggested there have been several loopholes in the investigation and in the system as well. While 23 special courts have being constituted for the trials of SCs/STs (APOA) Act cases, there are cases from 1994 which are still pending trial for various reasons.

Cops say they’re hopeful of the conviction rate increasing further on the special POCSO courts put in place to ensure the speedy trial of sexual offences against children. Cops also said that interventions like court monitoring system (CMS—which is a centralised, digital monitor interface that supervises court work to ensure speedy justice) has helped increase the conviction rate, as it helps rectify mistakes while filing chargesheets.

Title: Govt approves 2,600 EV charging stations
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Chennai: Giving a major impetus to electric vehicle (EV) mobility the government has approved installation of 2,600 EV charging stations in 62 cities under FAME II. Tamil Nadu will get 256 such charging stations while the union territory of Puducherry will get 10. Maharashtra tops the number of charging points with 317 followed by Andhra Pradesh with 266. Gujarat, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh will get 228, 205, and 207 EV charging stations respectively.

The union territories of Delhi and Chandigarh are expected to get 72 and 70 charging stations while Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh will get 10 each. The newly minted union territory of Jammu and Kashmir will get 25 charging points.

While Amitabh Kant, CEO, Niti Aayog tweeted that “this would remove range anxiety” as there will be “atleast one charging station” available in a grid of 4 square km, others in the industry called it too broad-brush to make a huge difference.

“A government initiative in EV is welcome, but I am not sure this broad-brush spread of setting up stations will help accelerate adoption. A better way is to set up specific corridors. Just 70 charging stations in Delhi which is the largest automobile market doesn’t make sense,” said Amitabh Saran, CEO, Altigreen Propulsion Labs.

The charging network, he added, focused too much on personal transportation which is not where EV conversion will happen first in India. “The developing market is very economics driven and here the top down approach of scaling down from pricey electric cars won’t happen,” he explained. “Here it will be bottom up with two, three wheelers and small commercial vehicles converting first because the economics favour it.” This bottom end of the pyramid needs to be catered to, he added.

The Society of Manufacturers of Electric Vehicles (SMEV) also feels that while the current initiative will be good for cars, a more low cost infrastructure is needed for two and three wheelers.

“This will greatly help the introduction of electric cars particularly the new launches that already have a good driving range. Another positive step that can greatly help the EVs, particularly the electric two wheelers would be to announce a scheme to install simple low cost charging points in sufficient numbers in the public parking lots and residential complexes,” said Sohinder Gill, director general, SMEV.

Title: Govt siddha wing plans 5km ‘Walkathon 2020’ on Sunday
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Trichy: A 5km walkathon has been planned in the city on Sunday, Januray 12, to mark National Siddha Day. The event will be organised by the department of Indian medicine and homeopathy to sensitize people on the health benefits of walking daily.

“While our organs work continuously to keep us alive and healthy, human beings betray themselves by choosing sedentary lifestyle. People have grown the habit of using motor vehicles to even cover a small distance for a work resulting in all types of lifestyle health issues,” said district siddha medical officer S Kamaraj on Monday.

Listing out the lifestyle diseases such as obesity, diabetes, cardiac problems etc. due to the lack of physical work, Kamaraj insisted on 45 minutes compulsory walking every day or at least thrice a week to prevent falling victim to heart diseases.

“Though several exercises are available for physical fitness, a brisk walk will have numerous positive health benefits on humans. Fat reductions, increasing oxygen supply, controlling diabetes, active mind and body are the few benefits of walking,” he said.

District collector S Sivarasu will flag off the walkathon at Anna Nagar Uzhavar Sandhai grounds. The walkathon will cover 5km stretch via Uzhavarsandhai – district court – Trichy city corporation office – Mutharaiyar statue – Campion school – Cantonment police station – MGR statue before returning to Uzhavarsandhai.

The registration for the participants commenced at the district siddha unit inside Mahatma Gandhi memorial government hospital in Trichy at free of cost. The participants can register their names from 8am to 5pm.

Title: Trichy: Man gets life imprisonment for sexually abusing his daughter
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

Title: Man, 37, gets life for sexually abusing his daughter, 10
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Thanjavur: A 37-year-old agricultural labourer was on Monday sentenced to four terms of life imprisonment by a mahila court in Thanjavur, for sexually abusing his 10-year-old daughter.

The convict, a native of Mathukur in Thanjavur was residing along with his daughter after his wife passed away in 2015. In 2017, her school teachers noticed some difference in the girl’s activities. When they inquired, they were shocked to find that her father had been sexually abusing her in an inebriated condition ever since her mother’s death. Immediately, they took up the issue with ChildLine authorities, who in turn, rescued the girl and sent her to a government home. Based on a complaint lodged by ChildLine authorities on November 20, 2017, the Pattukottai all-women police arrested the accused.

Meanwhile, medical examination revealed that the girl tested positive for HIV and the accused was the source of the disease. When the hearing came to an end on Monday, the mahila court judge Ezhilarasi sentenced the accused and slapped a fine of Rs 4,500 and ordered that the convict should spend his life in prison till his death. She further recommended the government to provide Rs 5 lakh solatium and medical care. TNN

Title: Chandigarh: BJP banks on Rajbala Malik for mayor, quells rebellion
Content:
Congress workers during an argument at the mayor’s office

BJP on Monday named Rajbala Malik as its candidate for the top post in the mayoral election in an announcement backed by all party members barring an evening revolt by a husband-wife couple that was controlled by BJP chief Sanjay Tandon

Purvanchal leaders are ignored: Shukla

CHANDIGARH: BJP on Monday named Rajbala Malik as its candidate for the top post in the mayoral election in an announcement backed by all party members barring an evening revolt by a husband-wife couple that was controlled by BJP chief Sanjay Tandon.Malik, considered to be close to MP Kirron Kher, had served as the mayor in 2012 when she was in the Congress. Tandon’s loyalist councillors Ravikant Sharma and Jagtar Singh Jagga were chosen as candidates for the posts of senior deputy mayor and deputy mayor. The elections will be held on January 10.At the MC office in Sector 17, drama was witnessed during the filing of nomination papers at the secretary’s chamber, when BJP councillor Chandrawati Shukla’s husband Gopal alias Pappu Shukla announced to file her papers as an independent candidate. Sensing trouble, Tandon and former mayor and BJP councillor Arun Sood ran outside and took the two away.Shukla, who was furious for his wife not being considered, argued with Tandon that he had played a vital role in bringing huge crowds for rallies during the Lok Sabha elections. As Congress leaders and media started gathering, BJP councilors and local leaders took Shukla and his wife from the first floor to the mayor’s office on the fifth floor to suppress the rebellion. The couple was kept there till 5pm, the deadline for filing the nomination papers.Shukla, who is a Tandon’s loyalist, was miffed with the leadership for not considering leaders from Purvanchal. “Purvanchal councillors play crucial role in bring crowd during the elections and ensuring victory of the party, but they are always ignored whenever any opportunity comes. We were hopeful to get one seat out of the three posts. The party’s leaders have assured me that they will consider us in the future and I am satisfied,” said Shukla. “The party is supreme for me. I have nothing to do with Congress. They are just playing politics,” he told TOIThe couple was kept there till 5pm, the deadline for filing the nomination papers.Shukla, who is a Tandon’s loyalist, was miffed with the leadership for not considering leaders from Purvanchal.“Purvanchal councillors play crucial role in bring crowd during the elections and ensuring victory of the party, but they are always ignored whenever any opportunity comes. We were hopeful to get one seat out of the three posts. The party’s leaders have assured me that they will consider us in the future and I am satisfied,” said Shukla. “The party is supreme for me. I have nothing to do with Congress. They are just playing politics,” he told TOI.

Title: Collector moots toll suspension on Pune-Satara highway
Content:
District collector Naval Kishor Ram has recommended the suspension of toll collection along the Pune-Satara hi... Read More

PUNE: District collector Naval Kishor Ram has recommended the suspension of toll collection along the Pune-Satara highway to the National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) over unsafe road conditions and incomplete work on National Highway 4.The proposal comes after a scrutiny of documents and a verification of the road conditions along the stretch.In mid-December last year, the collector had granted NHAI and the contractor PS Toll Road Private Limited (Reliance Infra) a last chance to complete pending works and improve road conditions by December 31. However, according to Ram and several citizens, none of the promised works have been completed.Speaking to TOI, Ram said, “After scrutiny of the documents, we have found that the concessionaire (Reliance Infra) has violated several clauses of the concession agreement with NHAI. The safety audit has also revealed that the road condition is unsafe. The construction of bridges remains incomplete, service roads are in a poor condition and there have been many more accidents due to lack of repairs. The physical verification by our teams also found the same results. I have proposed to the authority to discontinue toll collection and also initiate speedy needful action. I have done my part as the district collector and hope that they take corrective measures.”In his letter to the authority, Ram says, “NHAI, in its internal report, has stated that despite repeated notices, the contractor has failed to develop and implement solutions to improve road conditions which have led to an increase in road accidents. The NHAI, Pune has also invoked Clause 36.1 and 37.1 of the concession agreement signed on March 10, 2010 and asked Reliance to discontinue toll collection in December last year but the contractor has failed to act upon it. Works to the tune of Rs 160 crore continue to remain incomplete. Schedule D of the agreement also mentions that the contractor must resurface the highway once every five years but Reliance Infra has not taken action in this regard in the last 10 years.”Project director BK Singh said the works at Nasrapur, Varve and Sarola, which were to be completed by December 31, remain incomplete due to no mobilization of vendors. “There is no construction plan either. We have seen nearly 60 to 70 accidents and 40 to 45 fatalities along this stretch in the monsoon months last year,” he added.Sources close to the project said the NHAI has sent repeated notices to the contractor and sought penalty for incomplete work and poor maintenance instead of invoking clause 17.9 of the agreement and hiring a different agency to complete the work.“Not a single overlay or resurfacing has been done since the project commenced in 2010 which has led to extreme deterioration of the road condition. Only temporary carpeting of potholes was conducted when the need arose. There is a dearth of vendors as well which has caused work to be stalled. Instead of taking corrective measures like suspension of toll or others, NHAI has continued to support the contractor at the cost of the lives of citizens,” the source said.

Title: In leaflets, Maoists protest CAA & NRC
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: Maoists have scattered pamphlets in Balaghat district, announcing their opposition to CAA and NRC. In August last year, Maoists had called a bandh in parts of Chhattisgarh in protest against the abrogation of special status to J&K.

Sources said two kinds of pamphlets were found in Samnapur and Baghatola areas in the Mukki buffer zone of Kanha Tiger Reserve . One was against CAA and NRC, and in the other Maoists protested the displacement of tribals. Police are checking the authenticity of the leaflets.

“Some papers were found. They are being verified,” Balaghat SP Abhishek Tiwari told TOI.

Police have stepped up their combing and search operations in Balaghat following inputs of heightened movement of rebels in the district. Balaghat is on the trjunction of Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Maharashtra. The CPI (Maoists) carved out a new zone — Gadchiroli-Rajnandgaon-Balaghat (GRB) — for this region. Rebels use this corridor to hit in one state and run to another, which prompted police to devise a counter-strategy.

“Now, joint teams from Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh and Madhya Pradesh are working in tandem in search operations. Inter-state issues will not crop up,” Tiwari said, adding that combing ops have been intensified in all affected areas of the district. “Teams are regularly combing the jungles,” he said.

Title: Odisha high court seeks reply from government
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

CUTTACK: A PIL filed in the Orissa high court has sought intervention for release and rehabilitation of 14 persons suffering under bonded labour system in the guise of ‘Bartan’ syastem in a village of Dhenkanal district .

Acting on it, the court has issued notice to the state government to file a reply to the PIL.

Bartan is the medieval practice of extracting work from barbers and washermen by upper caste families paying a pittance of 75 kg of paddy for the whole year under an oral agreement in rural Odisha.

The state government had abolished the practice after the National Human Rights (NHRC) asked it in January 2011 to stop Bartan system and take action against those who failed to stop the “illegal practice or abetted it”.

The NHRC had described the practice as bonded labour within the definition of ‘bonded debt’ and ‘bonded labour’ as defined under the Bonded Labour System (Abolition) Act, 1976.

Anti-Slavery India (a public charitable trust) represented through its chairman Baghambar Pattanaik filed the petition on April 16, 2018. The case came up on Monday.

“After a preliminary hearing, acting Chief Justice Sanju Panda and Justice S K Sahoo posted the matter for hearing it after two weeks with the response from the authorities concerned,” petitioner’s counsel advocate Khirod Rout said.

“The bench, accordingly, issued notice to principal secretary, panchayati raj department, district collector, Dhenkanal, and sub-collector, Kamakhyanagar, to file their responses by then,” Rout said.

According to the petition, the 14 persons (barbers and washermen) of Gadagaonpur village under Bhuban block of Dhenkanal district are struggling for their release from bonded labour system and right to live with dignity.

When they refused to stick to this profession under Bartan system, they were subjected to social and economic boycott, followed by physical torture, the petition alleged.

The PIL has sought the court’s direction to release and rehabilitate the 14 persons, issue release certificates within 24 hours and provide immediate financial assistance of Rs 20,000 to each of them. The petition also sought direction to the state government to create a bonded labour rehabilitation fund at the district level with a corpus fund of at least Rs 10 lakh at the disposal of the district magistrate.

Title: First round of tendu leaves auction fetches Rs96 lakh
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Nagpur: The first round of auction to remove tendu leaves through e-tendering process has fetched Rs96.13 lakh towards sale of seven units on Monday. The forest department has put 279 units for sale in the state for 2020 season.

The tendu leaves collection starts in April-May and is a big source of employment for forest dwellers and non-dwellers. In the last five years, the forest department has distributed Rs257 crore to 9.7 lakh families in Vidarbha alone towards bonus to tendu collectors.

According TK Choubey, additional principal chief conservator of forests (APCCF) for non-timber forest produce, the department expects to generate 3,08,153 standard bags from 279 units which have been kept for sale. Maharashtra is the first state to start auction of tendu patta in Central India.

“The auction is a low-key affair as tendu-rich states like Telangana, Chhattisgarh and Madhya Pradesh have not started their auctions yet. Besides, traders still have old stock with them,” said Choubey.

The second and third round will be held from January 21-25, and February 7-1 respectively for groups of units unsold in previous rounds. Offers have been invited only in respect of units included in the non-scheduled areas and doesn’t include units falling in areas under community forest rights (CFRs).

Large tracts of forest are burnt at the behest of contractors in the wrong belief that it fetches better yield. As per the Indian State of Forest Report (ISFR)-2019, Maharashtra was the third state in the country with highest forest fire alerts after Mizoram (2,795) and Madhya Pradesh (2,723). Forest Survey of India (FSI), between November 2018 till June 2019, had issued 2,516 forest alerts to Maharashtra.

“If a fire takes place in tendu unit and deputy conservator concerned finds implementation of preventive measures as suggested in tender conditions were not carried out adequately then licensee will be imposed a penalty up of Rs15,000-Rs 30,000,” Choubey warned.

“This penalty will be for 5% of the tendu unit area burned. Above 10% of the tendu unit area burned, Rs50,000 per unit/group of units will be levied,” he added.

Title: House hunting picks up pace in city as executive capital buzz gets louder
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Visakhapatnam: With the wind blowing strongly in favour of Vizag as the state’s executive capital, top officials of various departments in Vijayawada have already swung into action and are busy searching for accommodation through their subordinates in the city.

Although the government is yet to issue an official statement or order on the executive capital issue, but following the statement of YSRC’s Rajya Sabha MP Vijayasai Reddy about setting up of the capital in Bheemili, most of the officers are believed to be searching for houses on the city’s outskirts.

A senior bureaucrat told TOI that officers of various departments have already started enquiry about rental accommodation in areas like Madhurawada, Yendada, Sagar Nagar, Rushikonda, and Mithilapuri Vuda Colony.

“When we were searching for a triple bedroom accommodation in Rushikonda and Yendada area, we came to know that many other government officials have already enquired about the accommodations,” a revenue official said.

A real estate developer said they too have come to know that many government officers have been enquiring about rented accommodation. “Due to scarcity of sand and the stringent Rera regulations, construction activity had come down in the last two years. On an average, 500 to 1,000 flats used to be sold every month in Vizag. But the number has come down to below hundred in recent months. Only big builders have the wherewithal to complete their ventures,” he said.

He said hundreds of flats are lying vacant which could house many top officers of the secretariat. “There are many big complexes near IT Park road at Mithilapuri Vuda colony where around 300 to 400 flats are almost ready and lying vacant as there are no buyers. In most complexes, hardly 25 per cent of flats are occupied, the rest are vacant and can serve those looking for rental accommodation,” he added.

Title: Man shoots self in front of cops in Mainpuri court
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: A 30-year-old accused in a triple murder case allegedly shot himself using a countrymade pistol in the presence of police in Mainpuri district court on Monday. Five constables were suspended for the lapse.

The incident took place barely a fortnight after a shoot-out within a courtroom in Bijnor in which an alleged history-sheeter was shot dead while he was appearing in a murder case by the son of a murdered BSP leader. The incident has set the alarm bells ringing over security arrangements in district courts in UP.

While the state government had earlier directed the state police to draft a security plan for district courts, the Allahabad High Court had directed the government to submit a detailed report of the security arrangements in place.

Police said that the accused Manish, in connivance with Kallu and Jitendra, had on October 9, 2012 shot dead his father Sukhram, stepmother Sushma Devi and brother Abhishek over a property dispute under Karhal police station area of the district.

Manish along with Kallu and Jitendra were produced in the court of Additional District Judge-IV, Tarun Kumar Singh for hearing in the 2012 triple murder case on Monday.

Police circle officer (Mainpuri city) Abhay Narayan Rai told TOI that around 3pm, before Manish was asked to personally explain the circumstances on the day of the crime by appearing in the court, he took out a countrymade weapon and shot at his right foot.

“Manish was sent to the district hospital and is out of danger. His statement is yet to be recorded by the police,” Rai added.

Title: Third closure report rejected, court summons ex-officers
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: A special CBI court on Monday rejected the third closure report submitted in the multi-crore theme-cum-amusement park project scam and summoned former UT adviser Lalit Sharma, former home secretary Krishan Mohan and former tourism director Vivek Atray and Unitech Limited director Ajay Chandra on January 20, implying that the trial would start.

Sharma, Mohan and Atray and Chandra had been booked for corruption, abuse of power and criminal conspiracy under sections 120 B, 420 and 201 of the IPC and sections 13(1)d and section 13(2) of Prevention of Corruption Act.

The CBI had registered the FIR on October 4, 2010, stating that former top UT officials in connivance with Unitech Limited indulged in criminal conspiracy and awarded 73.65 acres of land in Sarangpur to the company for a Rs 5.5-crore fixed annual licence fee and on 1.1%% annual revenue sharing basis. It was alleged the administration ignored financial rules while inviting tenders and shortlisting companies. These officers had allegedly “ignored” the highest bidder, DLF, and allotted the project to Unitech. The case had been referred to the CBI by the Central Vigilance Commission (CVC).

The third closure report was submitted in November 2018, stating no evidence was found against the accused. The CBI had earlier moved two closure reports in the case but the court rejected them, stressing the need for further investigation.

The court order stated, “The CBI had filed closure report in the case thrice. Complainant Vivek Aditya was not satisfied with the investigation and the closure reports. He has submitted photocopies of documents related to the arbitration proceedings initiated by Unitech Limited against the administration and claimed Rs 95 crore with respect to the project in question. The closure report is rejected and all the accused ordered to be summoned for January 20.”

The closure report stated, “...sufficient evidence has not emerged against the accused during the course of investigation. Further, no evidence has also emerged that the accused officials/accused company were in knowledge about the financial bid of DLF, in absence of which it could not be conclusively established that the accused officials acted in conspiracy with each other, to deliberately disqualify DLF and for making Unitech Limited the highest bidder. However, as the project has winded up…, no criminality can be attributed to the accused. The project has not been implemented ever since and thus no wrongful loss/gain was seen to have finally accrued to anyone.”

THEME PARK PROJECT SCAM

The Central Vigilance Commission (CVC) probed financial irregularities in the multi-crore theme-cum-amusement park project following a complaint from Vivek Aditya, an RTI activist, in 2009

The case was later shifted to the CBI

The CBI registered the FIR on October 4, 2010

It was alleged UT officials in connivance with Unitech Limited indulged in a criminal conspiracy and awarded 73.65 acres of land in Sarangpur for a Rs 5.5-crore fixed annual licence fee and on a 1.1%% annual revenue sharing basis

It was alleged the administration ignored financial rules while inviting tenders and shortlisting company for the project

The officers were accused of “ignoring” the highest bidder, DLF, and allotted the project to Unitech

The project never saw the light of the day after allegations of irregularities

1st closure report | April 18, 2012

Court rejected it on August 29, 2012

2nd closure report | February26, 2013

Court rejected it on June 7, 2013

This story is from January 7, 2020
