Title: Hyderabad News - Times of India
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

29-year-old man commits suicide

A 29-year-old man was found dead with his face wrapped in a plastic bag in Narsingi on Monday. Police suspect it to be a case of suicide as they found a note written by the deceased. Moulidhar had spoken to his sister over phone two days ago, but since then he could not be contacted. On Monday, his sister visited his home and found his body.

Unidentified body found

Rajendranagar police on Monday found an unidentified body lying on the footpath near a shopping mall in Attapur. Police said that the man was aged between 40 and 45 years. A case has been registered under section 174 (suspicious death) of CrPC.

Woman burnt to death at home

An 80-year-old woman died of burn injuries at her residence in Kamareddy district on Sunday night. The woman was identified as Vittava. The police said that she was sleeping when a kerosene lamp kept beside her fell and the fire spread. The woman died in her sleep.

Title: Hyderabad: Cops on patrol register 10 FIRs on Day 1 of scheme launch
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Hyderabad commissioner of police Anjani Kumar on Sunday launched a facility for police patrol vehicles to register FIRs and 10 complaints were filed on the first day. The initiative has been introduced as part of state police’s friendly policing methods.

“Happy to share that on the first day itself city patrol officers helped many citizens to register FIRs without visiting a police station. We thank the citizens for trusting the police patrol cars,” the city police chief said.

He further said that cases were registered at Charminar , Dabeerpura, Chilkalguda , Maredpally, Market, Chatrinaka, Falaknuma and Amberpet. The complaints were pertaining to suspicious deaths, kidnap, suicides, rash driving, road mishaps, assault and illegal sale of liquor.

East Zone DCP M Ramesh said all patrol vehicle officers have been counselled on how to interact with complainants and the process to follow after receiving a complaint.

Title: Haridwar: Forest department to slap fine on construction firm involved in all-weather road project
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Forest staff is currently estimating the loss due to construction works

HARIDWAR: The forest department has taken cognisance of the damage happening to the forest area that comes under Char Dham All-Weather Road widening project at Chinyalisaur in Uttarkashi. The department plans to send a notice to the construction company involved in the project.

Forest officials have been directed to analyse the damage caused to the local ecosystem due to the negligence of company workers. “We have learnt through our frontline team and local villagers that some areas under our jurisdiction have faced devastation. Our staff is estimating the loss and very soon we will be sending a penalty notice to the respective company,” Sandeep Kumar, division forest officer, Uttarkashi, told TOI. When asked about the amount of penalty which could be charged from the company, the official said, “The penalty may go higher than Rs 1 lakh. The amount will not just be calculated upon the loss of trees but also upon the loss of other natural resources (if any) in nearby areas.” Earlier on Sunday, shopkeepers and local residents of Bramkhal town had staged a protest against the construction company.

The locals alleged that the construction company is working carelessly and as a consequence, accidents have become more frequent.

They pointed out that there was rampant muck dumping and debris being left unattended on the road.

Meanwhile, the company officials have assured that the debris will be taken care of and the damaged drains and roads will soon be repaired. Notably, forest divisions of Kedarnath and Almora have earlier levied penalty on the construction companies for violating NGT norms by causing damage to local eco-system.

The all-weather road project is aimed at connecting Badrinath, Kedarnath, Gangotri, Yamunotri, and part of the route leading to Kailash Mansarovar yatra.

Title: Amravati: Jilted lover stabs 17-year-old girl to death
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

AMRAVATI: A jilted lover stabbed his 17-year-old sweetheart to death and later stabbed himself at Dhamangaon Railway town of the district this morning. The injured lover has been admitted to rural hospital in a serious condition.

Dhamangaon police said the victim, Pranita Kombe, was a resident of Old Dhamangaon town and a Std XII student at Sefla High School in Dhamangaon.

Dhamangaon police said the incident occurred around 11.15am when the girl was walking to school. The lover boy caught up with her and took her to a nearby garden and stabbed her in the belly several times. The girl collapsed on the spot. The boy then also stabbed himself to end his life.

The boy, Sagar Titurmare, 28, is a resident of Dattapur. DySP Poonam Patil said the murder took place following frustration out of a one-sided love affair. The injured accused has been moved to Yavatmal district hospital.

Title: Bharat Bandh called by trade unions may hit life in Odisha
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: The Bharat Bandh called by major trade unions and other associations on Wednesday to protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), economic slowdown, unemployment and the alleged anti-labour attitude of the Centre may hit life in the state.

As many as eight trade unions in Odisha including the Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU), the All India Trade Union Congress (AITUC), the Indian National Trade Union Congress (INTUC) and the All India Central Council of Trade Unions (AICCTU), the All India United Trade Union Centre (AIUTUC) and several other labour organisations have supported the strike.

Rama Krushna Panda, national secretary of AICTU, said Odisha Congress will support the bandh after meeting state party unit chief Niranjan Patnaik. Congress in a press statement confirmed that the party will support the bandh .

Besides pressing issues, Panda said, the trade unions demand a minimum wage of 21,000 per month, social security for unorganized sector workers, among others.

The strike may affect rail and bus services in the state. Except emergency services, the protesters will not allow other office or business work during the strike.

Title: Chennai: Four women con 20-year-old, kidnap, rob her at knifepoint
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: An all-women gang using a senior citizen as bait kidnapped a 20-year-old woman in an autorickshaw and robbed 15 sovereigns of gold jewellery at knifepoint in Kodungaiyur on Sunday night.

The victim Basheera Banu, 20, of Muthamizh Nagar in Kodungaiyur, was walking towards a restaurant to buy dinner when an old woman sought alms from her, police said. Police said she had just returned from a family function and was wearing gold jewellery.

“After Basheera gave her Rs 10, the elderly woman asked Basheera to help her cross the Tondiarpet High Road. Once they crossed the road, the elderly woman dragged Basheera to an autorickshaw, where three other women were present,” a police officer said, quoting the incident from Basheera’s complaint.

They bundled Basheera into the vehicle and sped away. After robbing her jewellery weighing more than 15 sovereigns at knifepoint, they dropped her at a random spot and fled, the officer said. Basheera borrowed a cellphone from a passerby and called her husband Mohammed Yusuf.

Based on a complaint, the Kodungaiyur police registered a case and are skimming through CCTV camera footage to identify the suspects. In her complaint, Basheera stated that the autodriver was a woman. “We suspect the elderly woman to be part of the gang too, since they took her in the same autorickshaw after abandoning the victim,” said an investigating officer.

Title: Vizag’s soil type better for construction
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Experts believe that the soil types in Visakhapatnam are far more suitable for construction than Amaravati , where the soil type is black-cotton.

Pointing out that the construction costs would come down, at least by 30% to 50% , if the executive capital were to be built in Visakhapatnam, experts said the northern and eastern sections of the city are suitable for construction of modern high rises.

“The major soil types in Visakhapatnam are sandy and rocky; construction activity in these two soil types is fairly simple, with no need for rafter-pylon combination. In case of Amaravati the soil type is predominantly black-cotton, which is lose and does not bind. Therefore there is a need to erect deep pylons coupled with rafters,” said, professor CNV Satyanarayana Reddy, an expert in soil-mechanics at the civil engineering department, Andhra University.

Ch Srinivas, vice-president of Credai, Visakhapatnam chapter, also agreed that construction cost would come down drastically. “If you look at the locations where land is being scouted, it is all rocky and sandy, therefore as per my estimate construction costs would be reduce by at least 30%.”

Former MLA, Vizag North, P Vishnu Kumar Raju concurred with their view and said, “The actual construction cost, including the air-conditioning and interiors, would not exceed Rs 5,000 per square foot in Visakhapatnam. In Amaravati the construction cost would be at least 50% to 100% more.”

Title: Capital region farmer dies of heart attack
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: For the third consecutive day, a farmer from the capital region died of cardiac arrest in Velagapudi village, in Guntur district , on Monday.

The deceased was identified as Gopal Rao (60). According to sources, Rao suffered the attack hours after he received the news that his grandson was being arrested for allegedly attacking a vernacular TV channel reporter’s car and attempting to murder her. Police sources said that they detained Rao’s grandson as they had video evidence against him and 14 others who allegedly vandalised the female scribe’s car trying to drag her out. Rao was also told that his grandson was found to be absconding in the case, despite the police giving notice seeking his cooperation.

Family sources said that the moment Rao received the news of his grandson’s arrest in an attempt murder case, he had collapsed and broke down. Moments later, Rao suffered a massive cardiac arrest leading to his death.

On Saturday and Sunday, two other farmers belonging to Dondapadu and Mandadam village in the capital region—who gave their lands for Amaravati—too died of cardiac arrest, taking the overall tally to three.

Title: Sought Rs 230 crore, UT gets Rs 135 crore
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: All government and many private schools reopened on Monday after the winter break but with minimal attendance owing to the cold.

The attendance was recorded as low as 7% in some government schools. Maximum government schools had less than 40% attendance.

The education department on Monday changed the timings of schools for the teaching staff in government and government aided schools. The new timings will be applicable till February. When asked if the department planned to change the timings for students too, Rubinderjit Singh Brar, director, school education, refused.

In Government Girls Model Senior Secondary School (GGMSSS), Sector 18, only 439 out of total strength of 1,739 turned up — only 25% attendance. At Government Model Senior Secondary School (GMSSS), Sector 22, only 8% students arrived. Sources said out of 1,168 students enrolled, only 105 turned up.

In Government Model Senior Secondary School, Sector 20, attendance was even lower at 7%. Here only 80 students were said to have attended the school while the total enrollment is 1,132. Similarly, Government Model High School (GMHS), Sector 7, recorded 19.15% attendance, Government High School (GHS), Sector 19 18.4% and GMSSS, Sector 19 19%.

Sources said total attendance of cluster number six, which includes GSSS, Sector 27 , GMSSS, Sector 38D, GMHS, Sector 28 C, GHS, Sector 29, GMHS, Sector 29 and GHS, Sector 30 had 11% attendance. In all six schools, 5,051 students are enrolled but only 559 attended schools.

In cluster 1, which includes GMSSS, Sector 8, GGMSSS, Sector 18, GMSSS, Sector 19, GMSSS, Kaimbwala, GHS, Sector 19 and GMHS, Sector 7 witnessed 25.5% attendance. Out of 8,623 students enrolled in all these schools, only 2,196 came.

The case was the same in other schools, teachers said. They said they were expecting low attendance since there had been forecast of cold weather this week and rain. “None of the schools I checked had more than 30% attendance,” said a teacher. Teachers are expecting low attendance till Wednesday. “If the weather remains cold and cloudy, students will not show up,” another teacher shared.

Parents, on the other hand, said the education department should have extended the vacation for another week. “It is extremely cold. The department can at least keep schools closed for primary schoolchildren,” said Bhavika Rana, a resident of Sector 32.

Surinder Singh another parent said, “there has been a forecast for this week of cold weather conditions due to rainfall, since last week. I don’t understand why department did not extend the vacations in such conditions. They could at least change the timings.”

Akash, a Class VIII student from one of the government schools, said, “Only 10 students had come in my class. It was very cold inside. We all have decided to not come if the weather remains cold. We only revised and did not study anything new.”

what neighboring cities are doing

Panchkula schools will remain closed January 15. In Punjab, school timings have been changed till January 15. Here, schools will be operational from 10am till 3pm. On Monday, as schools reopened, many private schools too changed their timings. Messages were sent to the parents in this regard.

Title: Uttarkashi: Kesar cultivation to help farmers in Uttarkashi
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

The high value crop was cultivated few months back on a trial basis on small patches of land in Sukki and Jhal... Read More

UTTARKASHI: To better the financial condition of local farmers, Krishi Vigyan Kendra in Chinyalisaur town successfully introduced saffron ( kesar ) crop cultivation in Upla Taknor region of Uttarkashi district , where farmers are largely involved in apple farming.

The high value crop was cultivated few months back on a trial basis on small patches of land in Sukki and Jhala villages of the district with support of Institute of Himalayan Bioresource Technology, Palampur, Himachal Pradesh. Delighted with the outcome of the project, local farmers have asked government agencies to provide seeds and technical assistance so that the crop can be cultivated in larger area.

“We have successfully cultivated kesar crop in Sukki village of Upla Taknor region of Uttarkashi district. In the initial trial, we cultivated the crop in nearly a 2,000 square feet land and got nearly 120 gram of high quality Kesar, which is worth Rs 20,000,” Pankaj Nautiyal, horticulture expert and in charge of Krishi Vigyan Kendra in Chinyalisaur, told TOI.

He said that Sukki, Jaspur, Purali, and other villages of Uttarkashi have conducive conditions for the cultivation of kesar as they are situated at an altitude of 1,800-2,200 metre above sea level and also receive optimum sunlight.

“Farmers of other high-altitude areas can also grow this crop. However, lack of proper climatic conditions may impact quantity and quality of crops. We witnessed this during our trial in Jhala village,” added Nautiyal.

Notably, Kesar is hailed as red gold due to its medicinal value and aroma.

Pratap Singh, a farmer from Sukki village who was involved with the team of experts for saffron cultivation, said, “Saffron crop takes less time. It is cultivated from August last week to September first week and becomes ready to be harvested by November end. Besides, the crop needs less space and farmers can cultivate it in the vacant spaces of their apple orchids. Therefore, farmers should choose this crop along with their regular apple cultivation to multiply their income.”

Another local farmer Mohan Singh Rana said, “Cultivation of saffron along with apple will be economically beneficial for farmers. Government agencies like horticulture department should spread awareness and provide support to farmers as it would be difficult and costlier for most of us to get good quality seeds and technical assistance from Himachal Pradesh and Jammu and Kashmir.”

Title: RTC to add 1,000 buses to fleet, including 250 in next 3 months
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: The AP State Road Transport Corporation, which became a government entity from January 1, plans to add 1,000 new buses to its fleet in financial year 2020-21, including 250 in the next three months, transport department principal secretary MT Krishna Babu said on Monday. He added that the fleet expansion would be done through acquisition and hiring route as the corporation is facing a shortage of drivers.

Asked about the current workforce strength of the RTC , Krishna Babu said the corporation has over 51,000 workers with a fleet of 12,500 buses. However, he denied that the corporation was overstaffed.

“RTC’s per bus staff strength is about 4.8 workers per bus, which is among the lowest among all government-owned bus companies in the country. The staff strength per bus was six in 2014, when bifurcation happened,” he told TOI.

Though RTC is grappling with a shortage of around 800 drivers, there are no plans as of now to hire new staff to replace the retiring employees, he said. “Each bus has a driver, conductor and mechanic to handle repairs. A shortage of 800 drivers means RTC will have to take a call on whether to outsource the requirement, or to hire new drivers. That’s a call the corporation has to take,” he added.

On whether the state government had budgeted for the wage bill of RTC for the current financial year, Krishna Babu said the monthly wage bill would be around Rs 300 crore. “The government will need to make arrangements for the wage bill for February and March this year. From next year, the annual wage bill will be Rs 3,600 crore,” he informed.

The decision to merge RTC into the government was taken by the state cabinet in September last year, based on the recommendations of an expert committee led by C Anjaneya Reddy, a former IPS officer who had served as managing director of APSRTC.

A merger with the government had been a long-standing demand of RTC employees to give them better job security. The AP budget was presented by finance minister Buggana Rajendranath in July last year, two months before the cabinet decision to merge the corporation with the government.

Title: JNU attack: Haryana speaker faces anger of students during seminar in Panjab University
Content:
This story is from January 7, 2020

Students hold a protest against the JNU attack at the Student Centre in Pannjab University, Chandigarh

CHANDIGARH: Haryana speaker Gian Chand Gupta faced the anger of a handful of Panjab University (PU) students over the JNU attack while he was addressing a seminar on ‘Women’s Participation in Decision Making’ at the evening department auditorium in PU on Monday.

Around 20 to 25 representatives of various student parties sitting in the more than 100-seater auditorium holding banners about the JNU attack started raising slogans like “Modi sarkar murdabad”, “Shame on Modi sarkar” and when Gupta started listing steps the central government had taken for empowering women and increasing the quantum of punishment for rapists. No BJP leader should talk about women empowerment as they themselves propagate attacks on women on campus, students alleged, demanding Gupta not be allowed to speak. They alleged that on one side the speaker claims the government is working on women empowerment while on the other its student body ABVP attacks JNU student organization president and professors. Their outburst prompted PU faculty to step in. Professor Emanual Nahar, dean student welfare, Professor Neena Capalash (DSW-women) and Professor Ashwani Kaul, chief of university security, forcefully removed the students out of the auditorium even as they continued the sloganeering.

Gupta described the students’ protest “a predetermined act”. He, however, said, “Everybody has the right to speak, but in a decent way.” Gupta also spoke about the violence in JNU. “There are people who have an agenda to divide the nation and we should make them understand that we all are united. Political parties should not indulge in campus issues,” Gupta said. He alleged those indulging in violence in universities get directions from their heads sitting abroad. Gupta said those opposing this seminar are against women empowerment and do not want any development or change to happen in the country. Earlier, one of the protesting students, Kanupriya, slammed the Centre for the violence on the JNU campus. “The Vidhan Sabha speaker (during seminar) was saying that they want to promote beti padhao. Is this way they will teach girls,” she asked.

‘Predetermined Act’

A few students start raising slogans against the BJP-led government when Haryana speaker Gian Chand Gupta starts listing steps taken to empower women during a seminar in PU

Students are forcefully removed from the seminar hall

Gupta describes the students’ protest “a predetermined act”, says everybody has the right to speak, but in a decent way

Title: Tech giant, startups in political crossfire with CAA-NRC, JNU violence raising heat
Content:
(File photo)

BENGALURU/CHENNAI: With the violence in JNU and the CAA-NRC issue reverberating across India, tech giants and startups are getting caught in the crossfire. Policybazaar, Zoho and Accenture are among those who are being forced to take sides.In Policybazaar's case, it has, paradoxically, hired actors from opposite ends of the political spectrum - Akshay Kumar and Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub - for its ad campaigns.And #BoycottPolicybazaar was trending all morning on Monday after actor Ayyub openly supported the JNU, Jamia, and Shaheen Bagh protests.BJP's Mumbai spokesperson Suresh Nakhua was among those who called for a boycott and asked the Soft-Bank-backed company if they supported the actor's stand.In Zoho's case, entrepreneurs including Nikhil Pahwa, A Ladak, and Sachin Tandon said they would no longer do business with the company or buy its products after CEO Sridhar Vembu defended his decision to attend an RSS event in Chennai.Accenture India MD Rama S Ramachandran is also in the spotlight for his decision to attend the same event, with some employees feeling his actions are questionable as Accenture's code of conduct does not allow participation in political events in a professional capacity.Scheduled on February 2, the two will share the stage with Anirudha Deshpande, the chief of All India Public Outreach at RSS. Some Twitter users wondered if the corporate policy of a global tech giant such as Accenture allowed for its representatives to align themselves with specific ideologies. They also tagged Accenture's global CEO Julie Sweet, requesting intervention.A few wondered what signals such participation would send to employees from minority communities.Tandon tweeted, "Not going to call for a boycott, since to each his own. But I'm in a position to cancel all business with @zoho thanks to @svembu's participation in this event."Amid the backlash, Vembu took to Twitter to say that his views do not depend on Twitter attacks. "If you dislike which events I attend, please do what your conscience dictates, and I will do what mine dictates. We earn our daily bread due to our work and we will continue to do quality work. I won't be responding to attacks," he wrote.There was also support for Vembu and Ramachandran, with users saying it was their personal prerogative, and noting that others like Abdul Kalam and Ratan Tata have also attended RSS events.Last year, Zomato took a strong stand when a user said he had cancelled an order on the platform since the delivery boy assigned was a non-Hindu. Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal said he wasn't sorry to lose any business from such consumers who come in the way of the company's values. Likewise in April 2018, when a VHP member cancelled a ride because the driver was Muslim, Ola put out a strong statement saying, "The company is a secular platform and it does not discriminate."Lloyd Mathias, a business and marketing strategist, said in today's 'activist economy' a brand's value and values are becoming intertwined and indistinguishable.
